page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Only two items appearto have historic significance. 1 Kenwith Castle is a grass and tree covered mound, standing at the high point of the Kenwith Valley. This spot is traditionally held to be the site of a battle in 879 A.D.between Hubba the Dane and Odun,the Saxon Earl of Devon, in which the Danes were routed. The new roadworks have narrowly avoided destruction of the mound. 2 A steam railway used to run from Bideford to Appledore via the Kenwith Valley, following the coast from Cornborough to Westward Ho! and Appledore. The track remains as a delightful coastal walk.
